assessments.task_description:
This assessment helps students review each day’s topics and in-class discussions to consolidate their understanding.

Students are required to verbally summarise and reflect for each class (10 classes) in 1.5 - 2 minutes and submit the video recording of their class summary and reflection within two days from each class at 5 pm.

  • Assessment period: Begins on 7 January 2026
  • First submission due: 9 January 2026 at 5 pm
  • Students are encouraged to complete their summary/reflection daily after each class.

Each summary/reflection is worth 3 points, totalling 30% of the final grade. Topics to be reviewed are indicated in Section 8: Learning Activities of the course profile.

Marking Criteria (per summary):

  • 1 point for an accurate and concise summary of the class content.
  • 1 point for a reflection that demonstrates original thinking (e.g., personal insights, interpretations, or connections to prior knowledge).
  • 1 point for inclusion of key points from class discussion (not just lecture content).


AI and MT Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.task_description:
Assessment: Essay (30%)

This essay requires students to discuss a research question in 2,500 words (+/-10%). The research question will ask students to integrate their learning from the course and develop their own perspectives on the Korean Wave. The question will be given out during Week 3, and on 21 January 2026, there will be a detailed discussion and Q&A on the essay topics and writing guidelines.

Direct quotations are not counted in the word limit but should not exceed 10% of the essay. Marks will be deducted if the essay does not adhere to the word limit. Essays must be submitted through Turnitin by 5 pm Friday Week 4 (30 January 2026).

Assessment: Essay summary presentation (10%)

Students are required to prepare a 4–5 minute video presentation summarising their essay. The presentation should:

  • Highlight the research question, main arguments, and key findings.
  • Be clear, concise, and well-structured.
  • Include any relevant examples or insights that strengthen the summary.

The video must be recorded using Microsoft Teams (link provided in the course Blackboard) and submitted by the same deadline as the essay (5 pm Friday Week 4, 30 January 2026). The video should begin with showing their student ID to the camera. This task assesses students’ ability to communicate their ideas effectively in a spoken format.

AI and MT Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
